alert.note: Alert for Lake (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 7:23PM CDT until April 02 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY, APRIL 02... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River Above Tiptonville. * WHEN...Until Sunday, April 02. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Fields are flooding east of Point Pleasant, Missouri. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.2 feet Friday evening. - Action stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
